oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 08 c
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 08 c. Newspaper clipping: 'You Are Invited.' Re: Mrs. Phillip Speed speaking about better motion pictures.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women; Motion pictures;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: YOU ARE INVITED To Attend Lecture on Movies Sunday. Mrs. L. C. French, president of Ossoli, Saturday invited Knoxville mothers and fathers-—and their families too—to attend the open forum on motion pictures to be held at 3 p. m. Sunday at the Bijou theater. Mrs. Philip Speed, of University of Virginia, will be the speaker. "Mrs. Speed is being sent out by the General Federation of Women's Clubs to campaign for better motion pictures," said Mrs. French Saturday. "She realizes the important fact that pictures; must be made better before the camera films them—not afterwards, with a censor's scissors. Opposes Censorship "Mrs. Speed is opposed to censorship. She dwells on moving pictures from the point of view of the mother. She is a mother herself . "During the war, Mrs. Speed selected pictures for soldiers in the army camps. "We want every parent to attend the meeting Sunday. Our interests in the movies is constructive not destructive." Prof. Frank Nelson will give a musical recital at the meeting. There is no admission charge.
